constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Erection of front 'Piggy-back' roof extension, rear 'Piggy-back' roof extension, single storey rear extension and garage side extension
decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The roofs of the extensions hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The garage hereby approved shall not be used for any purposes other than the parking of vehicles, or for storage purposes ancillary to the existing accommodation at 1A Birkenhead Avenue.Reason: To ensure the appropriate design and layout and the provision of adequate off-street parking accommodation and to avoid the congestion of surrounding roads by parked vehicles in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no windows or other openings shall be formed in the western flank walls and eastern and western roof pitches of the extensions hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The site comprises a semi-detached dwelling.8 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and no representations have been received. The key areas of assessment are: - The design of the proposed development; - The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings; and, - Fire Safety Assessment.DesignWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: The proposed single storey rear extension would adhere to the recommendations set out in the Residential Design SPD, and as such is considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development. The proposed extension would alter access arrangements to the rear garage, at present the splay in the rear wall would assit with access to the garage. No information in front of Officers would demonstrate that access would be prevented with the proposed extension. In any event there is parking to be found at the front of the dwelling. AmenityPolicy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance. Officer Comment: Given the modest depth of the proposed development, it is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy. Fire Safety AssessmentLondon Plan Policy D12(A) requires all development proposals to achieve the highest standards of fire safety, embedding these at the earliest possible stage.Officer Comment: The applicant has not submitted a Fire Safety Strategy, however, the plans include the provision of a suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point and officers see no reason why a development of the type sought could not comply with the rest of the provisions of Policy D12(A), the details of which could be secured through conditions. For these reasons, officers conclude that the proposal would not conflict with Policy D12 of the London Plan.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

Details required for conditions 4 (Construction Method Statement), 5 (Sustainable Urban Drainage System), 6 (Fire Safety Statement), 7 (Landscape Scheme) and Condition 8 (Arboricultural Method Statement) of planning permission 21/02564/FUL (Erection of a two storey, two bedroom detached dwelling with off street parking and a new parking space to the existing dwelling)Condition 4 (Construction Method Statement)A Construction Management Statement has been submitted which sets out construction details for the development. The CMS provides the necessary details required through the condition and the Council's Neighbourhood Traffic Engineer raises no objections to the details provided. On this basis, the condition can be discharged in full.Condition 5 (Sustainable Urban Drainage System)A drainage strategy has been submitted which sets out details of attenuating surface water by utilising a water butt and a rain garden. The Council's Lead Local Flood Adviser consider this an acceptable approach in line with the London Plan drainage hierarchy policy SI 13. This condition can be discharged in full.Condition 6 (Fire Safety Statement)A Fire Strategy has been submitted, prepared by an experienced architect with relevant qualifications, that sets out how the individual criteria in Policy D12 of the London Plan have been satisfied. The details provided are considered satisfactory and proportionate to the scale of development and this condition can be discharged in full. Condition 7 (Landscape Scheme) A landscape plan has been submitted which is consistent with the site plan approved through the parent permission and provides the necessary details required through the condition. The landscape plan shows a comprehensive landscaping scheme comprising of a wide range and variety of plants and trees that will contribute positively to the area and the Council's Trees and Landscape Officer is satisfied to discharge the condition based on the submitted plans. This condition can be discharged in full.Condition 8 (Arboricultural Method Statement)An Arboricultural Method Statement has been submitted which sets out details of tree works and tree protection. The AMS provides the necessary details required through the condition and the Council's Tree Officer raises no objections. On this basis, the condition can be discharged in full.SummaryFor the reasons set out above, the above conditions can be discharged in full.

SiteThe application site is a two-storey semi-detached dwellinghouse located on Northcote Avenue. The site is situated within Flood Zone 2/3 (medium probability).Planning History21/01686/CPU - Demolition of existing detached outbuilding and erection of new single storey enlarged detached outbuilding. Application Granted on 19 Jul 2021. With conditions.04/16135/FUL - Erection of single storey side extension incorporating garage and kitchen extension and front porch. Application Granted on 18 May 2004. With conditions.03/16056/FUL - Erection of single storey side extension incorporating garage and front porch. Refuse on 26 Mar 200302/16151/LDP - A change in roof profile from hip to gable and the erection of a projecting rear dormer (LDC/P). Application Granted on 16 Sep 2002.Consultations13 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and no representations were received.ConsiderationThe key areas of assessment are: The impact of the development on character and appearance. The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.The impact of the development on drainage. The impact of the development on fire safety. When read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area.Officers Comments: The application proposes the construction of a first floor side extension, above an existing single storey side extension. This extension would be set back from the front elevation of the dwelling and set down from the ridge line. Furthermore, the proposed extension would not exceed 50% of the width of the original dwelling. Whilst the proposed first floor side extension would not be set down in line with the recommended 500mm as outlined by the Residential Design Guide, Officers note that the extension would appear proportionate and subordinate to the dwellinghouse and would therefore have an acceptable impact on its character and appearance.The application also proposes the construction of a single storey rear extension, in place of an existing conservatory. This extension would measure approximately 4 metres in depth from the rear wall of the dwellinghouse and would have a flat which would measure a maximum of 3 metres in height. Officers consider that this extension would also appear proportionate and subordinate to the dwellinghouse and would therefore have an acceptable impact on its character and appearance.Finally the application proposes 4 no. solar panels. The proposed solar panels will be fixed on an angled support frame, such that they would sit approximately 280mm above the top of the flat roof of an existing dormer extension. The proposed changes are considered acceptable in terms of their design and would result in a negligible impact on the character and appearance of the host dwellinghouse and wider streetscene.Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officers Comments: It is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.Policy SI12 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM4 of the Council's Core strategy 2012 require development proposals to accord with the flood risk policies set out in the NPPF.Officers Comments: London Plan Policy D12(A) requires all development proposals to achieve the highest standards of fire safety, embedding these at the earliest possible stage.Officer comment: The applicant has not submitted a Fire Safety Strategy, however, the plans include the provision of a suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point and officers see no reason why a development of the type sought could not comply with the rest of the provisions of Policy D12(A), the details of which could be secured through conditions. For these reasons, officers conclude that the proposal would not conflict with Policy D12 of the London Plan.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).
Please revise the supporting documents if require to match the revise description of proposal.

The submitted roof plans have an incorrect scale bar. Please provide existing and proposed roof plans at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of entire property not just part and showing dimensions of proposed work. The plans must show the direction of North. Although the inclusion of a scale bar is not mandatory, it is highly encouraged.
